public class JUnit3TestSuiteImpl
extends org.smartfrog.services.xunit.base.AbstractTestSuite
implements JUnitTestSuite, junit.framework.TestListener

Implementation of the Junit3.8.x test suite component. This is where tests are actually run; we bring up Junit internally and run it here.

Method Detail

sfStart

public void sfStart()
             throws org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException,
                    java.rmi.RemoteException
Can be called to start components. Subclasses should override to provide functionality Do not block in this call, but spawn off any main loops!

Specified by:
sfStart in interface org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.Prim
Overrides:
sfStart in class org.smartfrog.services.xunit.base.AbstractTestSuite
Throws:
org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException - failure while starting
java.rmi.RemoteException - In case of network/rmi error

java.rmi.RemoteException - on trouble

buildClassList

protected void buildClassList()
build the list of classes to run. At this point the list is already flat. If the user has asked for a single test, so singleTest is not null, then only tests that end with that pattern are tested.

                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,

startTest

public void startTest(junit.framework.Test test)
A test started. Note that if a test throws an exception in TestCase.setUp() then this callback is not invoked by Junit. We need to be aware of this fact.

Specified by:
startTest in interface junit.framework.TestListener
Parameters:
test - test

onStart

public org.smartfrog.services.xunit.serial.TestInfo onStart(junit.framework.Test test)
note that a test has started by adding the current time to the startedTests hashtable if it is not already there, and incrementing the started count in the statistics. If it is there, do nothing.

Parameters:
test - test
Returns:
test informatation

onEnd

public org.smartfrog.services.xunit.serial.TestInfo onEnd(junit.framework.Test test,
                                                          java.lang.Throwable fault)
call this when a test ends to set up the start and end times right.

Parameters:
test - the test
fault - optional fault detail
Returns:
the test information including start and end time.
